item.title: 美国 7 月批发库存小幅下调
item.description: 在销售大幅反弹的情况下，7 月份美国批发库存的增幅低于最初的预期，这让人怀疑库存投资是否会促进第三季度的经济增长。【原文：U.S. wholesale inventories increased less than initially thought in July amid a sharp rebound in sales, casting doubt on whether inventory investment would contribute to economic growth in the third quarter.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会处罚 7 家违反举报人保护措施的上市公司
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周一表示，七家上市公司同意支付合计 300 万美元，以了结该委员会对其违反举报人保护措施的指控。【原文：Seven public companies agreed to pay a combined $3 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges they violated whistleblower protections, the regulator said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国提议要求高级人工智能和云服务提供商提交报告
item.description: 美国商务部周一表示，它正在提议要求高级人工智能开发商和云计算提供商提供详细的报告要求，以确保这些技术是安全的，能够抵御网络攻击。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said Monday it is proposing to require detailed reporting requirements for advanced artificial intelligence developers and cloud computing providers to ensure the technologies are safe and can withstand cyberattacks.】

item.title: Starboard 建议取消新闻集团的双层股权结构
item.description: 对冲基金 Starboard Value 周一表示，该公司已提交一份股东决议，要求取消允许鲁珀特-默多克控制《华尔街日报》出版商新闻集团的双层股权结构。【原文：Starboard Value has filed a shareholder resolution to eliminate the dual-class share structure that allow Rupert Murdoch to control News Corp , the publisher of the Wall Street Journal, the hedge fund said on Monday.】

item.title: KeyCorp 出售近 70 亿美元的低收益投资
item.description: 美国 KeyCorp 银行周一表示，已出售约 70 亿美元的低收益投资证券。【原文：U.S. bank KeyCorp said on Monday it had sold about $7 billion of low-yielding investment securities.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，汇丰考虑合并商业银行和投资银行以降低成本
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，汇丰银行正在酝酿将其商业银行部和投资银行部合并，以消除重叠的职能，削减成本。【原文：HSBC is mulling the combination of its Commercial and Investment banking divisions to eliminate overlapping roles at the lender and cut costs, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Progress 拟以 8.75 亿美元收购云软件部门 ShareFile
item.description: Progress 软件公司周一表示，将以约 8.75 亿美元的价格收购云软件集团的 ShareFile 部门，这家人工智能驱动的软件公司希望扩大其企业产品组合。【原文：Progress Software said on Monday it would buy Cloud Software Group's unit ShareFile for about $875 million, as the AI-powered software firm looks to boost its enterprise product portfolio.】

item.title: 混合动力汽车给铂金金属带来生机
item.description: 由于电动汽车的普及速度放缓，混合动力汽车的销量激增，这将在未来几年出人意料地刺激对铂族金属（PGM）的需求，就像现在预测的煤炭寿命延长一样。【原文：A surge in sales of hybrid cars as electric vehicle take-up slows is set to provide an unexpected boost to demand for platinum group metals (PGMs) in the coming years, similar to the extended lifespan now predicted for coal.】

item.title: 华为三折手机在苹果 iPhone 16 发布前获得 300 万份预订单
item.description: 中国科技巨头华为公司（HWT.UL）的网站周一显示，其三折智能手机的预购量已超过 300 万部。【原文：Chinese tech giant Huawei (HWT.UL) has garnered more than 3 million pre-orders for its triple-folding smartphone, its website showed on Monday, which comes just hours before Apple's debut of its new generation of iPhones.】

item.title: 软着陆乐观情绪不减，期指本周开局上扬
item.description: 与华尔街主要股指挂钩的期货周一上涨，从上周的重挫中反弹，原因是在本周晚些时候的一份重要通胀报告公布之前，投资者对美国经济的软着陆前景保持乐观。【原文：Futures tied to Wall Street's main indexes gained on Monday, rebounding from heavy losses last week, as investors remained optimistic about soft landing prospects for the U.S. economy ahead of a crucial inflation report later in the week.】

item.title: 拉丁美洲电子商务之王称 MercadoLibre 有巨大的增长空间
item.description: 拉丁美洲电子商务巨头 MercadoLibre Inc（已成为该地区最有价值的上市公司）的首席执行官马科斯-加尔佩林（Marcos Galperin）说，公司才刚刚起步。【原文：Marcos Galperin, chief executive of Latin American e-commerce giant MercadoLibre Inc - already the region's most valuable listed firm - says the company is just getting started.】

item.title: 据《论坛报》报道，赛峰集团正与 MBDA 公司就 Roxel 公司的股份进行谈判
item.description: 据法国《论坛报》周一报道，法国喷气发动机制造商赛峰集团和欧洲导弹制造商 MBDA 正在就可能出售战术推进系统业务 Roxel 进行谈判。【原文：French jet engine maker Safran and European missile maker MBDA are in talks over the potential sale of tactical propulsion systems business Roxel, French weekly La Tribune reported on Monday.】

item.title: 市场发出需求疲软信号，摩根士丹利下调布伦特原油价格观点
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）周一下调了未来几个季度的布伦特原油预测，并表示全球石油市场正面临一段类似于经济衰退时期的需求疲软期。【原文：Morgan Stanley on Monday cut its Brent crude oil forecasts for coming quarters and said the global oil market is facing a period of demand weakness similar to those seen during recessions.】

item.title: 土耳其企业在经济危机中面临倒闭潮
item.description: 杜根-杜曼（Dogan Duman）很难想象如何能让他位于土耳其中部的制衣厂继续运营下去，即使他已经解雇了三分之一的员工，以削减全国企业飙升的成本，并引发了一波破产和倒闭潮。【原文：It is hard for Dogan Duman to see how he can keep his garment factory in central Turkey running much longer, even after firing a third of his staff to cut costs that have soared for companies nationwide, generating a wave of bankruptcies and closures.】

item.title: 数据显示，美国几家大型科技公司的员工压倒性地支持卡马拉-哈里斯
item.description: 捐款数据显示，美国许多最大科技公司的员工压倒性地支持民主党总统候选人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris），而一些最有权势的科技亿万富翁则支持共和党对手唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）。【原文：Workers at many of the largest U.S. tech companies overwhelmingly back Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris, according to donation data, even as some of the most powerful tech billionaires have thrown their support to Republican rival Donald Trump.】

item.title: 美国对 78.1 万多辆 Stellantis 汽车引擎盖下起火事故展开调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周一表示，已对约 781459 辆斯泰兰特汽车在点火装置处于 "关闭 "状态时发生的火灾展开调查。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Monday it had opened a probe into about 781,459 Stellantis vehicles over a fire occurring while the vehicle's ignition was in an 'OFF' state.】

item.title: 工会谈判接近僵局，加航准备停航
item.description: 加拿大航空公司周一表示，由于与飞行员工会的谈判接近僵局，该公司正在最后确定暂停大部分业务的应急计划。【原文：Air Canada is finalizing contingency plans to suspend most of its operations as talks with the pilot union are near an impasse, the airline said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国 工资单后的立足点、新款 iPhone 和辩论
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 谷歌网络广告反垄断审判即将开始
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌周一将在弗吉尼亚州亚历山大面对美国反垄断检察官，司法部将试图证明谷歌扼杀了在线广告技术领域的竞争，这是该搜索巨头最近第二次与司法部摊牌。【原文：Alphabet's Google will face U.S. antitrust prosecutors on Monday in Alexandria, Virginia, where the Justice Department will seek to show the company stifled competition in online advertising technology, in the search giant's second recent showdown with the Justice Department.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会阻止 Tapestry-Capri 合并案开庭审理
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会将敦促纽约联邦法官在周一开始的庭审中阻止 Tapestry 公司以 85 亿美元并购竞争对手手袋制造商 Capri Holdings 公司，理由是这将消除 "平易近人的奢侈品 "市场的激烈竞争。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission will urge a federal judge in New York to block Tapestry's $8.5 billion merger with rival handbag maker Capri Holdings at a trial beginning on Monday, arguing it will eliminate fierce competition in the market for "accessible luxury."】

item.title: 谷歌隐私沙盒的采用成本给小型广告技术公司造成负担
item.description: 在互联网巨头谷歌的数字广告业务已经受到美国和英国审查之际，小型广告技术公司对谷歌酝酿已久的 Cookie 替代方案 "隐私沙盒 "提出了竞争担忧。【原文：Smaller ad-tech firms are raising competition concerns over Google's long-brewing cookies alternative, Privacy Sandbox, at a time when the internet giant's digital ads business is already under U.S. and UK scrutiny.】

item.title: 苹果 iPhone 16 将聚焦人工智能功能
item.description: 苹果公司将于周一发布其 iPhone 16 系列产品，重点关注其旗舰设备的功能如何注入人工智能，而不是像往常那样强调硬件升级。【原文：Apple on Monday is set to unveil its iPhone 16 lineup, focusing on how its flagship device's features have been infused with artificial intelligence, rather than its usual emphasis on hardware upgrades.】

item.title: 独家报道黎智英香港传媒公司高管对 BDO 发起法律挑战
item.description: 两位长期在香港工作的西方媒体高管指责全球会计师事务所 BDO 违反国际规则，帮助香港政府清算由在狱中的富豪黎智英经营的公司。【原文：Two Western media executives with long experience in Hong Kong have accused global accounting firm BDO of breaking international rules by helping the city's government liquidate the company, which was run by the jailed tycoon Jimmy Lai.】

item.title: 德拉吉敦促改革和大规模投资重振落后的欧盟经济
item.description: 马里奥-德拉吉（Mario Draghi）周一在一份期待已久的报告中表示，欧盟要想在经济上与竞争对手美国和中国并驾齐驱，就需要更加协调的产业政策、更加迅速的决策和大规模的投资。【原文：The European Union needs far more coordinated industrial policy, more rapid decisions and massive investment if it wants to keep pace economically with rivals the United States and China, Mario Draghi said on Monday in a long awaited report.】

item.title: 波音公司达成临时劳资协议后股价上涨，可能避免大规模罢工
item.description: 周一，波音公司股价在美国股市盘前交易中上涨 3%，此前该飞机制造商与美国西北太平洋地区的一个工会达成了一项临时协议，避免了本周晚些时候可能发生的严重罢工。【原文：Boeing shares rose 3% in U.S. premarket trading on Monday after the planemaker reached a tentative deal with a union in the U.S. Pacific Northwest that could avoid a possible crippling strike later this week.】

item.title: 市场升温，对冲基金涌向日本
item.description: 在亚洲 4,000 亿美元的对冲基金行业中，日本一枝独秀，在其他地区基金纷纷关闭的同时，日本却吸引了大量基金发行，这表明 8 月份的剧烈波动并没有破坏日本资本市场的复苏。【原文：Japan has emerged as a standout in Asia's subdued $400 billion hedge fund sector, drawing fund launches while other regions suffer closures in an indicator that wild volatility in August has not derailed a revival in Japanese capital markets.】

item.title: 中国汽车销量连续第五个月下降
item.description: 周一的行业数据显示，8月份中国乘用车销量连续第五个月下降，但纯电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车的销量有所增长，这得益于对驾驶者换购污染较重车辆的补贴。【原文：Passenger vehicle sales in China fell in August for the fifth straight month, industry data showed on Monday, though sales of all-electric and plug-in hybrid models rose, helped by subsidies for drivers trading in more polluting vehicles.】

item.title: 欧洲股市在经历一年多来最差周度表现后反弹
item.description: 上周五，欧洲基准股指创下一年多来的最差表现，本周欧洲股市开盘表现积极，投资者正在等待一系列经济数据，并预计欧洲央行将在本周晚些时候降息。【原文：European shares began the week on a positive note after the benchmark index saw its worst day in over a year on Friday, while investors await a slew of economic data and expect the European Central Bank to cut interest rates later in the week.】

item.title: 松下能源部门准备生产 4680 块电动汽车电池
item.description: 日本松下控股公司（Panasonic Holdings）的能源部门周一表示，该公司已完成了 4680 电动汽车电池的量产准备工作，将开始向汽车制造商供应这种电池。【原文：The energy unit of Japan's Panasonic Holdings has finalised preparations for the mass-production of its 4680 electric-vehicle batteries, the company said on Monday, as it seeks to start supplying the cell to automakers.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势加剧，中国 8 月出口可能进一步放缓 - 路透社调查
item.description: 由于全球需求降温和贸易壁垒增加有可能使世界第二大经济体的亮点黯淡，中国 8 月份的出口增速可能是四个月来最慢的。【原文：China's exports likely grew at the slowest pace in four months in August, as cooling global demand and mounting trade barriers threaten to dim a bright spot in the world's second-largest economy.】
